Package com.taco.suit_lady.util.tools

Class CalculationTools

java.lang.Object
com.taco.suit_lady.util.tools.SLCalculations
public class CalculationTools extends Object
Contains methods related to doing various calculations.

  • Method Details

    • getAbsoluteDifferent

      public static int getAbsoluteDifferent​(Number number1, Number number2)
      Returns the absolute value difference between the two specified integers.

      This method will evaluate the two values as |a - b|.

      Parameters:
      number1 - The first integer.
      number2 - The second integer.
      Returns:
      The absolute value.

    • getAbsoluteDoubleDifferent

      public static double getAbsoluteDoubleDifferent​(Number number1, Number number2)
      Returns the absolute value difference between the two specified integers.

      This method will evaluate the two values as |a - b|.

      Parameters:
      number1 - The first integer.
      number2 - The second integer.
      Returns:
      The absolute value.

    • getPerHour

      public static long getPerHour​(int value, long startTime)
      Returns the per hour value for the specified value.
      Parameters:
      value - The value to evaluate.
      startTime - The time in milliseconds when the tracking of the value started.
      Returns:
      The per hour value.

    • round

      public static int round​(int number, int place)
      Rounds the specified number to the specified place (non-decimal).

      See roundD(double, int, int) to round decimals.

      Parameters:
      number - The number being rounded.
      place - The place being rounded to.
      Returns:
      The formatted number.
      See Also:
      roundD(double, int, int)

    • roundD

      public static double roundD​(double number, int decimalShift, int decimalPlace)
      Moves the decimal point over decimal shift places, and then rounds the specified double to the specified decimal place.

      For example: roundD(4563.2352345342, 2, 1) returns 456.32 .

      See round(int, int) to round whole numbers.

      Parameters:
      number - The number being rounded.
      decimalShift - The number of places the decimal place is being moved over.

      Note that this calculation

      decimalPlace - The decimal place to round to.
      Returns:
      The specified double to the specified integer place and specified floating place.

    • isMultipleOf

      public static int isMultipleOf​(int i, int number)
      Rounds the specified int (i) to a value that is a multiple of the second specified int (number). If i less than number, then 0 is returned.
      Parameters:
      i - The number being rounded.
      number - The returned value must be a multiple of this number.
      Returns:
      The a value that is a multiple of the second specified int, or 0 if i less than number.

    • distanceTo

      public static double distanceTo​(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      Returns the distance between the points defined by Point(x1, y1) and Point(x2, y2).
      Parameters:
      x1 - The x coordinate of the first point.
      y1 - The y coordinate of the first point.
      x2 - The x coordinate of the second point.
      y2 - The y coordinate of the second point.
      Returns:
      The distance between the points defined by Point(x1, y1) and Point(x2, y2).

    • isPointWithinRange

      public static boolean isPointWithinRange​(Point p1, Point p2, int range)
      Checks if the two specified points are within the specified range of each other using their x and y coordinates.

      This method does NOT use the distance formula.

      Parameters:
      p1 - The first point.
      p2 - The second point.
      range - The range.
      Returns:
      True if the two specified points are within the specified range of each other, false otherwise.

    • getLongkmb

      public static long getLongkmb​(String kmbStr, boolean throwException)
      Returns the integer representation of the specified kmb String, or 0 if there was an error.

      Note that the kmb String uses RuneScape rules, therefore no decimals are allowed. IE, if it wouldn't work in RuneScape, it won't work here.

      This method allows for negative numbers.

      Parameters:
      kmbStr - The kmb String.
      throwException - True if this method should throw an exception if the conversion cannot be completed, false if it should return 0.
      Returns:
      The integer representation of the specified kmb String.

    • getkmb

      public static double getkmb​(String kmbStr, boolean throwException)
      Returns the double representation of the specified kmb String, or 0 if there was an error.

      Note that the kmb String does allow decimals.

      This method allows for negative numbers.

      Parameters:
      kmbStr - The kmb String.
      throwException - True if this method should throw an exception if the conversion cannot be completed, false if it should return 0.
      Returns:
      The double representation of the specified kmb String.

    • getPercent

      public static int getPercent​(int value, char charr)
      Gets what percentage of the specified value is the specified character. The character should be a character that can be contained within a number, or this method will always return 0.
      Parameters:
      value - The int being checked.
      charr - The char.
      Returns:
      What percentage of the specified value is the specified character. The character should be a character that can be contained within a number, or this method will always return 0.

    • clampMin

      public static <T extends Number> T clampMin​(T value, T min)
      Returns a value that is greater than or equal to the specified min value.
      • If the specified value is greater than the min value, the specified value is returned
      • If the specified value is less than the min value, the min value is returned.
      Parameters:
      value - The value.
      min - The min value.
      Returns:
      A value that is greater than or equal to the specified min value.

    • clampMax

      public static <T extends Number> T clampMax​(T value, T max)
      Returns a value that is less than or equal to the specified max value.
      • If the specified value is less than the max value, the specified value is returned
      • If the specified value is greater than the max value, the max value is returned.
      Parameters:
      value - The value.
      max - The min value.
      Returns:
      A value that is less than or equal to the specified max value.

    • clamp

      public static <T extends Number> T clamp​(T value, T min, T max)
      Returns a value that is between the specified min and max values.
      • If the specified value is between the specified min and max values, the specified value is returned
      • If the specified value is less than the min value, the min value is returned.
      • If the specified value is greater than the max value, the max value is returned.
      Parameters:
      value - The value.
      min - The min value.
      max - The max value.
      Returns:
      A value that is between the specified min and max values.

    • fittsLaw

      public static double fittsLaw​(double delay, double dist, double size, double speed)
      Calculates the amount of time a mouse movement should take based on Fitts' Law.
      Parameters:
      delay - The time taken for the user to realize the mouse needs to be moved.
      dist - The distance from the current position to the center of the target.
      size - The width of the target.
      speed - The speed of the mouse movement.
      Returns:
      The amount of time (in ms) the movement should take
      See Also:
      https://en. wikipedia.org/wiki/Fitts%27s_law

    • gaussian

      public static double gaussian​(double t)
      Satisfies Integral[gaussian(t),t,0,1] == 1D. Therefore can distribute a value as a bell curve over the interval 0 to 1.
      Parameters:
      t - A value, 0 to 1, representing a percent along the curve.
      Returns:
      The value of the gaussian curve at this position.

    • gaussTable

      public static double[] gaussTable​(int steps)
      Returns an array of gaussian values that add up to 1 for the number of steps Solves the problem of having using an integral to distribute values.
      Parameters:
      steps - Number of steps in the distribution.
      Returns:
      An array of values that contains the percents of the distribution.

    • degDistance

      public static double degDistance​(double deg1, double deg2)
      Calculates the distance in degrees between two angles, always in the range of [0, 180].
      Parameters:
      deg1 - The degrees of the first angle.
      deg2 - The degrees of the second angle.
      Returns:
      double

    • flipLine

      public static List<? extends Point> flipLine​(List<? extends Point> line)
      Reflects all of the points in the specified list over the straight line between the first and the last points.
      Parameters:
      line - The line to flip.
      Returns:
      line
